text: my name is James ponsoldt and I'm the
director of the spectacular now the
scene is the first meeting between our
two leads that's Amy
played by shailene woodley and Sutter
played the miles teller this is about
five minutes into the film and
previously we've sort of went with
Sutter on this wild ride where he's
gotten really drunk and woken up on a
lawn I thought for a second that maybe
you were dead I'm dead we shot this film
in Athens Georgia which is where I was
born and raised and the houses of this
film the streets are sort of where I
grew up and played as a kid we filmed
this scene late lately in the afternoon
and this is in August it's really hot
really humid and we're faking for Dahlan
it's supposed to be around 6 a.m. we
wanted sort of a hazy sky and when we
first meet Amy there's sort of a halo of
sunlight you're sort of just peeking
through the trees you knew my name
you go to the same school you wouldn't
know who I am you know the sort of
emotional arc of the characters is there
is this sort of I guess traditional
meet-cute on the lawn but it's not about
sort of a Manic Pixie dream girl saving
our protagonist it's a much more
complicated relationship we film this on
anamorphic 35 millimeter wide screen
which is really important to me to not
sort of because it's a film about
teenagers I didn't just want to do it on
a sort of de Burgh or fashion like on a
handheld found-footage iPhone or 5d I
wanted something that felt timeless and
epic and really dignified the emotions
of these characters and the actors and I
had an agreement where they could do
anything they wanted in front of the
camera as long as they were willing to
try anything that I asked of them Amy no
you're jogging around the neighborhood
and I don't know where my car is so I
think that we can help each other out
and that was sort of the spirit of the
film it was a collaboration where
everybody could bring their ideas to the
table and we let the best ideas went out
